5448.verse-arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ قُلْ أُوحِيَ إِلَيَّ أَنَّهُ اسْتَمَعَ نَفَرٌ مِّنَ الْجِنِّ فَقَالُوا إِنَّا سَمِعْنَا قُرْآنًا عَجَبًا
5448.verse-english: Say, [O Muhammad], "It has been revealed to me that a group of the jinn listened and said, 'Indeed, we have heard an amazing Qur'an.

clauses-english.clause: Say,
[O Muhammad],
"It has been revealed to me that a group of the jinn listened and said,
'Indeed,
we have heard an amazing Qur'an.

5449.verse-arabic: يَهْدِي إِلَى الرُّشْدِ فَآمَنَّا بِهِ ۖ وَلَن نُّشْرِكَ بِرَبِّنَا أَحَدًا
5449.verse-english: It guides to the right course, and we have believed in it. And we will never associate with our Lord anyone.

clauses-english.clause: It guides to the right course,
and we have believed in it.
And we will never associate with our Lord anyone.

5450.verse-arabic: وَأَنَّهُ تَعَالَىٰ جَدُّ رَبِّنَا مَا اتَّخَذَ صَاحِبَةً وَلَا وَلَدًا
5450.verse-english: And [it teaches] that exalted is the nobleness of our Lord; He has not taken a wife or a son

clauses-english.clause: And [it teaches] that exalted is the nobleness of our Lord;
He has not taken a wife or a son

5451.verse-arabic: وَأَنَّهُ كَانَ يَقُولُ سَفِيهُنَا عَلَى اللَّهِ شَطَطًا
5451.verse-english: And that our foolish one has been saying about Allah an excessive transgression.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَأَنَّهُ كَانَ يَقُولُ سَفِيهُنَا عَلَى اللَّهِ شَطَطًا

clauses-english.clause: And that our foolish one has been saying about God an excessive transgression.

5452.verse-arabic: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّا أَن لَّن تَقُولَ الْإِنسُ وَالْجِنُّ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا
5452.verse-english: And we had thought that mankind and the jinn would never speak about Allah a lie.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّا أَن لَّن تَقُولَ الْإِنسُ وَالْجِنُّ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا

clauses-english.clause: And we had thought that mankind and the jinn would never speak about God a lie.

5453.verse-arabic: وَأَنَّهُ كَانَ رِجَالٌ مِّنَ الْإِنسِ يَعُوذُونَ بِرِجَالٍ مِّنَ الْجِنِّ فَزَادُوهُمْ رَهَقًا
5453.verse-english: And there were men from mankind who sought refuge in men from the jinn, so they [only] increased them in burden.

clauses-english.clause: And there were men from mankind who sought refuge in men from the jinn,
so they [only] increased them in burden.

5454.verse-arabic: وَأَنَّهُمْ ظَنُّوا كَمَا ظَنَنتُمْ أَن لَّن يَبْعَثَ اللَّهُ أَحَدًا
5454.verse-english: And they had thought, as you thought, that Allah would never send anyone [as a messenger].

clauses-english.clause: And they had thought,
as you thought,
that God would never send anyone [as a messenger].

5455.verse-arabic: وَأَنَّا لَمَسْنَا السَّمَاءَ فَوَجَدْنَاهَا مُلِئَتْ حَرَسًا شَدِيدًا وَشُهُبًا
5455.verse-english: And we have sought [to reach] the heaven but found it filled with powerful guards and burning flames.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَأَنَّا لَمَسْنَا السَّمَاءَ فَوَجَدْنَاهَا مُلِئَتْ حَرَسًا شَدِيدًا وَشُهُبًا

clauses-english.clause: And we have sought [to reach] the heaven but found it filled with powerful guards and burning flames.

5456.verse-arabic: وَأَنَّا كُنَّا نَقْعُدُ مِنْهَا مَقَاعِدَ لِلسَّمْعِ ۖ فَمَن يَسْتَمِعِ الْآنَ يَجِدْ لَهُ شِهَابًا رَّصَدًا
5456.verse-english: And we used to sit therein in positions for hearing, but whoever listens now will find a burning flame lying in wait for him.

clauses-english.clause: And we used to sit therein in positions for hearing,
but whoever listens now will find a burning flame lying in wait for him.

5457.verse-arabic: وَأَنَّا لَا نَدْرِي أَشَرٌّ أُرِيدَ بِمَن فِي الْأَرْضِ أَمْ أَرَادَ بِهِمْ رَبُّهُمْ رَشَدًا
5457.verse-english: And we do not know [therefore] whether evil is intended for those on earth or whether their Lord intends for them a right course.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَأَنَّا لَا نَدْرِي أَشَرٌّ أُرِيدَ بِمَن فِي الْأَرْضِ أَمْ أَرَادَ بِهِمْ رَبُّهُمْ رَشَدًا

clauses-english.clause: And we do not know [therefore] whether evil is intended for those on earth or whether their Lord intends for them a right course.

5458.verse-arabic: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا الصَّالِحُونَ وَمِنَّا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ كُنَّا طَرَائِقَ قِدَدًا
5458.verse-english: And among us are the righteous, and among us are [others] not so; we were [of] divided ways.

clauses-english.clause: And among us are the righteous,
and among us are [others] not so;
we were [of] divided ways.

5459.verse-arabic: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّا أَن لَّن نُّعْجِزَ اللَّهَ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَن نُّعْجِزَهُ هَرَبًا
5459.verse-english: And we have become certain that we will never cause failure to Allah upon earth, nor can we escape Him by flight.

clauses-english.clause: And we have become certain that we will never cause failure to God upon earth,
nor can we escape Him by flight.

5460.verse-arabic: وَأَنَّا لَمَّا سَمِعْنَا الْهُدَىٰ آمَنَّا بِهِ ۖ فَمَن يُؤْمِن بِرَبِّهِ فَلَا يَخَافُ بَخْسًا وَلَا رَهَقًا
5460.verse-english: And when we heard the guidance, we believed in it. And whoever believes in his Lord will not fear deprivation or burden.

clauses-english.clause: And when we heard the guidance,
we believed in it.
And whoever believes in his Lord will not fear deprivation or burden.

5461.verse-arabic: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا الْمُسْلِمُونَ وَمِنَّا الْقَاسِطُونَ ۖ فَمَنْ أَسْلَمَ فَأُولَٰئِكَ تَحَرَّوْا رَشَدًا
5461.verse-english: And among us are Muslims [in submission to Allah], and among us are the unjust. And whoever has become Muslim - those have sought out the right course.

clauses-english.clause: And among us are Muslims [in submission to God],
and among us are the unjust.
And whoever has become Muslim -
those have sought out the right course.

5462.verse-english: But as for the unjust, they will be, for Hell, firewood.'

clauses-english.clause: But as for the unjust,
they will be,
for Hell,
firewood.

5463.verse-arabic: وَأَن لَّوِ اسْتَقَامُوا عَلَى الطَّرِيقَةِ لَأَسْقَيْنَاهُم مَّاءً غَدَقًا
5463.verse-english: And [Allah revealed] that if they had remained straight on the way, We would have given them abundant provision

clauses-english.clause: And [God revealed] that if they had remained straight on the way,
We would have given them abundant provision

5464.verse-arabic: لِّنَفْتِنَهُمْ فِيهِ ۚ وَمَن يُعْرِضْ عَن ذِكْرِ رَبِّهِ يَسْلُكْهُ عَذَابًا صَعَدًا
5464.verse-english: So We might test them therein. And whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord He will put into arduous punishment.

clauses-english.clause: So We might test them therein.
And whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord He will put into arduous punishment.

5465.verse-arabic: وَأَنَّ الْمَسَاجِدَ لِلَّهِ فَلَا تَدْعُوا مَعَ اللَّهِ أَحَدًا
5465.verse-english: And [He revealed] that the masjids are for Allah, so do not invoke with Allah anyone.

clauses-english.clause: And [He revealed] that the masjids are for God,
so do not invoke with God anyone.

5466.verse-arabic: وَأَنَّهُ لَمَّا قَامَ عَبْدُ اللَّهِ يَدْعُوهُ كَادُوا يَكُونُونَ عَلَيْهِ لِبَدًا
5466.verse-english: And that when the Servant of Allah stood up supplicating Him, they almost became about him a compacted mass."

clauses-english.clause: And that when the Servant of God stood up supplicating Him,
they almost became about him a compacted mass.

5467.verse-arabic: قُلْ إِنَّمَا أَدْعُو رَبِّي وَلَا أُشْرِكُ بِهِ أَحَدًا
5467.verse-english: Say, [O Muhammad], "I only invoke my Lord and do not associate with Him anyone."

clauses-english.clause: Say,
[O Muhammad],
"I only invoke my Lord and do not associate with Him anyone.

5468.verse-arabic: قُلْ إِنِّي لَا أَمْلِكُ لَكُمْ ضَرًّا وَلَا رَشَدًا
5468.verse-english: Say, "Indeed, I do not possess for you [the power of] harm or right direction."

clauses-english.clause: Say,
"Indeed,
I do not possess for you [the power of] harm or right direction.

5469.verse-arabic: قُلْ إِنِّي لَن يُجِيرَنِي مِنَ اللَّهِ أَحَدٌ وَلَنْ أَجِدَ مِن دُونِهِ مُلْتَحَدًا
5469.verse-english: Say, "Indeed, there will never protect me from Allah anyone [if I should disobey], nor will I find in other than Him a refuge.

clauses-english.clause: Say,
"Indeed,
there will never protect me from God anyone [if I should disobey],
nor will I find in other than Him a refuge.

5470.verse-arabic: إِلَّا بَلَاغًا مِّنَ اللَّهِ وَرِسَالَاتِهِ ۚ وَمَن يَعْصِ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ فَإِنَّ لَهُ نَارَ جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا أَبَدًا
5470.verse-english: But [I have for you] only notification from Allah, and His messages." And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger - then indeed, for him is the fire of Hell; they will abide therein forever.

clauses-english.clause: But [I have for you] only notification from God,
and His messages.
" And whoever disobeys God and His Messenger -
then indeed,
for him is the fire of Hell;
they will abide therein forever.

5471.verse-arabic: حَتَّىٰ إِذَا رَأَوْا مَا يُوعَدُونَ فَسَيَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ أَضْعَفُ نَاصِرًا وَأَقَلُّ عَدَدًا
5471.verse-english: [The disbelievers continue] until, when they see that which they are promised, then they will know who is weaker in helpers and less in number.

clauses-english.clause: [The disbelievers continue] until,
when they see that which they are promised,
then they will know who is weaker in helpers and less in number.

5472.verse-arabic: قُلْ إِنْ أَدْرِي أَقَرِيبٌ مَّا تُوعَدُونَ أَمْ يَجْعَلُ لَهُ رَبِّي أَمَدًا
5472.verse-english: Say, "I do not know if what you are promised is near or if my Lord will grant for it a [long] period."

clauses-english.clause: Say,
"I do not know if what you are promised is near or if my Lord will grant for it a [long] period.

5473.verse-arabic: عَالِمُ الْغَيْبِ فَلَا يُظْهِرُ عَلَىٰ غَيْبِهِ أَحَدًا
5473.verse-english: [He is] Knower of the unseen, and He does not disclose His [knowledge of the] unseen to anyone

clauses-english.clause: [He is] Knower of the unseen,
and He does not disclose His [knowledge of the] unseen to anyone

5474.verse-arabic: إِلَّا مَنِ ارْتَضَىٰ مِن رَّسُولٍ فَإِنَّهُ يَسْلُكُ مِن بَيْنِ يَدَيْهِ وَمِنْ خَلْفِهِ رَصَدًا
5474.verse-english: Except whom He has approved of messengers, and indeed, He sends before each messenger and behind him observers

clauses-english.clause: Except whom He has approved of messengers,
and indeed,
He sends before each messenger and behind him observers

5475.verse-arabic: لِّيَعْلَمَ أَن قَدْ أَبْلَغُوا رِسَالَاتِ رَبِّهِمْ وَأَحَاطَ بِمَا لَدَيْهِمْ وَأَحْصَىٰ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ عَدَدًا
5475.verse-english: That he may know that they have conveyed the messages of their Lord; and He has encompassed whatever is with them and has enumerated all things in number.

clauses-english.clause: That he may know that they have conveyed the messages of their Lord;
and He has encompassed whatever is with them and has enumerated all things in number.
